titleproper.value:
Guide to the Lisa Fox and Curt Royston Papers
                    <lb/>1980-1987
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MSS 249</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Ashley Todd, 2011.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2016-06-20T15:40-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Lisa Fox and Curt Royston Papers

p.value: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/> Identification of item, date (if known); Lisa Fox and Curt Royston Papers; MSS 249; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

Curt Royston is best known for his proficiency in a variety of media: painting, sculpture, photography, film, and video, and often in combination. His work has been shown extensively throughout the United States and Europe including a 1987 one-man exhibition at the Whitney Museum of American Art. Lisa Fox was a leading dancer with the Merce Cunningham Dance Company from 1976-1980 and has been a choreographer with Lisa Fox Danse for over thirty years. Together Royston and Fox collaborated on a series of multimedia installations, as well as a number of 16mm dance-based films throughout the 1980s, the most popular of which is "In Artificial Light" (1983).
This collection contains reviews, photographs, transparencies, posters, video and film related to the multimedia collaborations of Lisa Fox and Curt Royston.
